skill.description: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill when the user asks to build web components, pages, or applications. Generates creative, polished code that avoids generic AI aesthetics.

skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with no code execution or external dependencies. Contains only design guidelines and creative direction for frontend development.

content.value_statement: Creates distinctive, production-grade web interfaces with bold aesthetic choices that stand out from generic AI-generated designs through intentional typography, color, motion, and spatial composition.
actual_capabilities: Generate production-grade HTML/CSS/JS, React, or Vue code
Create bold, distinctive aesthetic directions for interfaces
Implement advanced CSS animations and micro-interactions
Design cohesive color schemes and typography systems
Create unconventional layouts with asymmetry and spatial creativity
Apply visual effects like gradients, textures, and atmospheric backgrounds
limitations: Requires user to provide context about purpose, audience, or constraints
Does not include backend or API integration
Focuses on aesthetics and design rather than complex application logic
Relies on developer's ability to iterate on the generated code

prompt_templates.title: Minimalist Product Page
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a product page for a luxury watch brand. The interface should be brutally minimal with generous negative space, refined typography, and subtle animations. Target audience is high-end consumers who value craftsmanship.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need an elegant, restrained design that emphasizes quality

prompt_templates.title: Maximalist Creative Portfolio
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a portfolio page for a digital artist. The design should be maximalist chaos with overlapping elements, bold colors, experimental typography, and playful animations. It should feel like walking through a vibrant gallery.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you want to create an energetic, attention-grabbing interface

prompt_templates.title: Retro-Futuristic Dashboard
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a dashboard for a music streaming app with a retro-futuristic aesthetic. Think synthwave colors, geometric patterns, and smooth transitions. Users are millennials who love 80s nostalgia.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to evoke a specific era or cultural aesthetic

prompt_templates.title: Organic Nature-Inspired Interface
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a meditation app interface with organic, natural aesthetics. Soft curves, earthy tones, flowing animations, and calming typography. The design should feel peaceful and grounding.
prompt_templates.scenario: When the content requires a soothing, harmonious visual approach

output_examples.input: Build a hero section for a tech startup's website. Modern, bold, and energetic.
output_examples.output: Production-ready React component with: custom gradient mesh background, distinctive display font (e.g., Syne or Cabinet Grotesk), staggered text reveal animations, asymmetric layout with overlapping elements, sharp accent colors, and micro-interactions on CTAs

output_examples.input: Create a pricing table with a brutalist aesthetic.
output_examples.output: HTML/CSS implementation featuring: monospace typography, stark black/white contrast, raw geometric borders, no rounded corners, bold typography hierarchy, minimal hover states with high contrast, and grid-based rigid layout

best_practices: Always start by defining purpose, tone, and differentiation before coding
Choose distinctive fonts that match the aesthetic direction (avoid Inter, Roboto, Arial)
Commit to a bold aesthetic vision rather than playing it safe
Use CSS variables for color and spacing consistency throughout the design
Implement animations thoughtfully - one orchestrated page load beats scattered micro-interactions
Match code complexity to aesthetic vision (elaborate for maximalist, precise for minimalist)
Create atmospheric backgrounds with gradients, textures, or patterns instead of solid colors
Test accessibility (contrast, keyboard navigation, screen readers) alongside aesthetic choices
Vary design approaches - never converge on the same fonts, colors, or layouts across projects
anti_patterns: Using generic font families like Inter, Roboto, Arial, or system fonts without intentional reason
Defaulting to purple gradients on white backgrounds (cliched AI aesthetic)
Creating cookie-cutter designs that lack context-specific character
Building the same predictable layouts and component patterns repeatedly
Adding complexity without purpose or restraint without intention
Ignoring the user's context, audience, and purpose when making design choices
Implementing elaborate animations in minimalist designs or bare implementations for maximalist visions

faq.question: What frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill generates code for vanilla HTML/CSS/JS, React, and Vue. It adapts to your technical constraints and can work with most modern frontend frameworks.

faq.question: How do I get the best results from this skill?
faq.answer: Provide context about your project's purpose, target audience, and aesthetic preferences. The more specific you are about the tone and direction you want (e.g., 'brutally minimal,' 'retro-futuristic,' 'organic'), the better the output will match your vision.

faq.question: Will the generated code be production-ready?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill generates functional, production-grade code. However, you may need to integrate it with your existing codebase, add backend connections, or adjust for specific technical requirements.

faq.question: How does this avoid generic AI aesthetics?
faq.answer: The skill explicitly avoids common AI design patterns (like overused fonts and purple gradients) by committing to bold, context-specific aesthetic directions. It varies typography, color schemes, and layouts across generations to create truly distinctive interfaces.

faq.question: Can I request specific design styles or themes?
faq.answer: Absolutely! You can request specific aesthetics like minimalist, maximalist, brutalist, art deco, industrial, editorial, retro-futuristic, or describe your own unique direction. The more specific your vision, the better.
